Data Processing

This section documents functions related to data processing.

Check Continuity and re-Index

check_Continuity_and_reIndex.check_Continuity_and_reIndex(df: DataFrame, time_column: str = 'Time (s)') → DataFrame

Checks for continuity in the specified time series column of a DataFrame and reindexes it to fill any missing timestamps with NaN values.

This function generates a complete range of timestamps from the minimum to the maximum found in the specified time column. It then reindexes the DataFrame to include all timestamps in this range, introducing NaN values for any missing timestamps in other columns.

Parameters

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – The input DataFrame containing the time series data.

  • time_column (str) – The name of the column in df containing the time series timestamps. Defaults to “Time (s)”.

Returns

A DataFrame with the same columns as df, reindexed to include a continuous range of timestamps, filling missing timestamps with NaNs.

Return type

pd.DataFrame

Examples

>>> import pandas as pd
>>> data = {'Time (s)': [1, 2, 4, 7], 'Value': [10, 15, 20, 25]}
>>> df = pd.DataFrame(data)
>>> reindexed_df = check_continuity_and_reindex(df)
>>> print(reindexed_df)

Note

The function assumes that the timestamps in time_column are integer values representing seconds.
